content: taiyo linier top designed by sian price-white this easy and light top is knitted flat in two pieces and then seamed together the length of both the sleeves and the body are easily adjusted this is a great pattern for those that are new to knitting yarn and materials  2 balls noro taiyo sock yarn or any similar 4 ply fingering yarn you can use 2 different colours for the front and the back to make it reversible  5 5mm us 9 needles straight or circular on at least an 80cm 32 cable  yarn needle to sew seams sizing one size but can be easily adjusted you can check the length as you go to change the length of the sleeves increase /decrease the number of cast on stitches to change the length of the body increase /decrease the number of pattern repeats the sample is approx 85cm wide and 45cm in length gauge 18 sts x 10cm on 5 5mm needles but this is not terribly important abbreviations k1 knit one stitch p1 purl one stitch st stitch rs right side ws wrong side yo yarn over - wrap your yarn once around the right hand needle to make an extra stitch 2 pattern  cast on 150 stitches  repeat next 12 row row 1 10 knit in stocking stitch knit all right side row and purl all wrong side row row 11 ws - *knit 1 yo* repeat from * to * until last stitch knit 1 row 12 rs - *purl 1 drop yo* repeat from * to * until last stitch purl 1  continue in pattern until piece measures approx 45cm or the length you want from shoulder to front hem  place all sts onto spare needle cable or scrap yarn  now cast on again for the second side and repeat so that you have an exact copy of your first side casting off  there are 3 different ways that i m going to explain how to cast off pick which suits your skill level and patience  the 1st way is probably the simplest cast off all sts loosely with a larger needle from both sides pin the cast off edges together from sides towards the centre leaving a section in the middle as your neck hole try it on the see how big you want the neckline the sample has a 68cm hole for the neck now hand sew the two sides together making sure that your right sides are facing  the 2nd way is shown on the sample on one side k54 cast off 42sts and then slip remaining 54 sts onto right needle if you would like a wider or narrower neckline adjust the st count accordingly on the other side k54 cast off 42sts and then slip the knitted sts from the right needle back onto the left needle now use the 3 needle bind off method to cast off both sleeves
